name: Ramada Plaza Sault Ste. Marie Ojibway

reviews.title: Great assistance from Robert with our planning needs.
reviews.text: I just made reservations. My son (11) and I wanted to go on a long weekend together. I called this hotel. Robert spent a great deal of time answering my questions, finding us the "best deals" for accommadations with a view and attractions. I appreciate that our needs were listened to and we were provided many options. I feel confident that the vacation Robert helped me set up will be a wonderful experience for me and my son..

reviews.title: I-500 Snowmobile Races-
reviews.text: We have been chartering a bus to take our family and friends to the Sault for the annual I-500 Snowmobile races. The hotel staff had cookies waiting for our group. The reception certainly let us know we were appreciated and destined to have a wonderful weekend. We shared so many funny stories in the bar with the staff and the views from the Frieghters dining room were spectacular as was the food. We made our reservations with the hotel for next year before we left. Good Job, Ojibway!! The Wilson Bunch

reviews.title: Historic hotel
reviews.text: We recently spent a delightful long weekend at the Ojibway Hotel. Our check in with Linda was very fast and pleasant. We asked what there was to do in the Soo and Linda, very honestly, said not to much in the winter. She asked us if we were skiers, no; snowmobilers, no. She told us about Minneapolis Woods and it's great tubing run and we went and had a blast! She also gave us Comp tickets to Lake Superior State University's hockey games which we enjoyed very much.

reviews.title: Great Staff & Service
reviews.text: Freighter's Restaurant and the Pub had great food. Both Linda and Karen encouraged us to come back in the summer & fall when there is much more to see and do in this beautiful area of our state. And we will and the Ojibway will be our choice for our home away from home.P

reviews.title: Ramada Plaza Ojibway
reviews.text: While traveling for work I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Ramada Plaza Ojibway in Sault Ste. Marie. What a treat!!! The staff was the most courtsey I have ever met. When I arrived they had fresh baked cookies at the desk. My check in was fast a friendly. Linda was great, she told me all about the hotel and the restaurant. My room was very nice and clean. My room overlooked the locks and I spent my evening watching the freighter's. In the morning I had a great breakfast in the restaurant before checking out.I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Sault Ste. Marie. You will not be disappointed!!!!

reviews.title: Historic Experience
reviews.text: What treat! This is the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in. The decorating is very boutique. We stayed in the President Bush Suite 209. We had a huge hot tub in our room. It was gorgeous. The craftmanship was delightful. We are returning for a snowmobile weekend as the trail ends at the lounge! We were able to watch the ships in the Locks while we ate dinner in the 4 star dining room. Needless to say we will be booking more conferences . You will never be treated more kindly or efficiently. Ask for Karen or Linda! Great Gals. Thanks.John and Joani

reviews.title: 5 Star Service
reviews.text: The Ojibway Hotel will always be special in our memories. The hotel opened in 1927 and has been restored over the years. It exudes old country and the staff is remarkable. They couldn't do enough for us. The Freighters Restaurant was the icing on the cake. The food and service was 5 star. Our acomodations was a beautiful three room suite. The hotel was close to all the gift shops and museums.The Soo Locks was directly across the street.We recommend this hotel for the discreet traveler. Bill and Sue

reviews.title: Wow! The Soo Locks
reviews.text: This hotel overlooked the Soo Locks and we could watch the ships from our room and the dining room. The hotels restaurant was the best on our trip. We will be back. Clay Mayhew

The waterfront is as close as you could say to being "downtown" in Sault Ste Marie, MI. There's plenty of pubs that also serve food and some shops around as well. The hotel restaurant is pricey for dinner but pretty competitive for lunch. Their club sandwich is highly recommended.
reviews.title: An average place in a fairly nice location

reviews.text: The hotel is a mixed bag. It is in an older building so the age and atmosphere is obvious; I stayed on a 4th floor room. the room was nicely appointed, the bathroom was decorated well but when the temperature rose up to 84 the a/c in the room couldn't keep up. the room was quite warm at times.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree that the basement is kind of dark and droopy and the workout room is too small and almost claustrophobic. After seeing the workout room I don't bother to check the pool. The room internet service, despite having cabled and wireless was sporadic.
reviews.title: character

reviews.text: If location convenience is your thing this hotel won't disappoint. If modern stylishness and newer properties appeal to you there are better choices. See my other review in this town.
reviews.title: Good location, poor house keeping unimaginative menu

likes.disliked: — price of resturant, quality of food, cleanlyness

reviews.text: This hotel is overpriced for what it delivers. Don't let the elegant lobby fool you into thinking the rest of the hotel is nice. It was average, at best. The pool, while indoors, is in the basement and not at all inviting. The ceilings in the hallways are low and actually drooping in some places. There was peeling wallpaper in the bathroom and the upholstery on the 1 chair in the room had seen much better days.
reviews.title: Nice Little Hotel

likes.disliked: — AC didn't work as well as it should have

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night in early May. The hotel is situated on the main street in Sault Ste Marie and is rather out of character with the other buildings which are essentially gift shops and a couple of bars / restaurants. The main attraction though is Soo Locks and Freighters Restaurant offers an excellent view of the big ships as they pass through the locks.
reviews.title: Great restaurant - Freighters

reviews.text: Our room was well appointed, clean and spacious. A nice touch was the manager checking with us that the room was to our satisfaction.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience!
thanks robert
reviews.text: Freighters restaurant on site has an excellent reputation and rightly so. We stayed on a quiet Monday and the service and food was excellent. Also check out the Captains Pub for a drink and to watch your favourite program on one of the many TV's.

reviews.title: Best place to eat in Soo, MI
reviews.text: I would recommend the Ramada Plaza Hotel for an overnight stay or as a base for exploring the UP of Michigan.

reviews.title: Great Place to stay
reviews.text: Anyone who visits Sault Ste. Marie who doesn't stay at the Ojibway is missing so much. We have stayed there every time we have come to the Soo. The rooms have been redone and the Freighters Resturant is top notch regardless of when you dine there. The hotel is situated next to the Soo locks and, if you are in the right rooms, you can watch the ships pass through right from your window!

aka: Ramada Plaza Ojibway Hotel Sault Sainte Marie
description: This Historical Hotel site on a site overlooking the Famous Internation Soo Locks. We are the Home of the Famous Freighters Restaurant and the Captains Pub and Grill. We will celebrate our 75th Anniversary on New Years Eve. Since 1927 this hotel has hosted Presidents and diplomats from all over the world. The senior president Bush hosted us with his presence in 1982. This property exhuberates with nostalgia from eras gone by. Take a trip through time as you enjoy our history and artifact display. Our staff is one of few who pay attention to the details of your comfort. Enjoy the luxurious lobby and historic lighting. Shop at all the gift shops. Whether you are snowmobiling or checking in to read your favorite book call and book with our staff. You deserve to savor the moment in one of our hot tub suites. Call now!
